solution.text:
Draw a right angled triangle with its perpendicular sides of length \(2\) units and \(1\) unit respectively.
Now by using Pythagoras theorem,
Length of hypotenuse \(=\sqrt{2^2+1^2}=\sqrt5\).
Construct BC of unit length perpendicular to OB.
Using Pythagoras theorem,
Length of hypotenuse \(=\sqrt{(\sqrt5)^2+1^2}=\sqrt6\).
Using a compass with center O and radius OC, draw an arc that intersects with the number line at point A.
